thread.title: Report: More visitors heading to Georgia city
thread.title_full: Report: More visitors heading to Georgia city

author: Carla Caldwell
title: Report: More visitors heading to Georgia city
text:
Creatas Columbus, Ga., is attracting more visitors, according to a new report. More than 1.8 million people visited Columbus, Ga., in fiscal year 2015, up from 1.7 million in 2014. People visiting for tourism, business meetings, conferences, reunions and military graduations spent about $340 million overall in the last year, reports the Ledger-Enquirer. The activity contributed to 4,477 jobs with a payroll of more than $119 million, the Columbus Convention and Visitors Bureau told the Columbus paper, citing numbers compiled by Columbus State University's Butler Center for Business and Economic Development. Anything connected to the outdoors is big right now in Columbus, according to tourism officials. Activities include the Chattahoochee River whitewater and zip line courses, the RiverWalk, running competitions and sporting events at South Commons, home of the Summer Olympic softball games in 1996, the paper adds.
